KBase Data API

KBase Data API documentation¶

Contents:

Semantic type system¶

The semantics module implements a basic description language for describing how types relate to each other (a "type system"). The base object in this system is a Type:

class data_api.semantics.Type(spec)[source]¶

An object describing a single type.

__init__(self, spec)[source]¶

Create type from JSON spec.

The JSON specification should be as follows:

{
// Optional namespace for type name
"namespace": "kbase.us",
// Type name using UpperCamelCase convention
"name": "BananaBunch",
 // Description of what these objects mean
"description": "A yellow fruit",
// List of properties, each with name and type.
// These are the value(s) for your type.
"properties": [
    {"name": "num", "type": "int"},
    {"name": "type", "type": "string"},
],
// Zero or more statements about the relationship to
// other objects, which are pairs of the form
// ("relationship", "NameOfObject").
// The :class:`Statements` class defines constants for
// standard relationships.
"statements": [
    (Statement.extends, "Fruit"),
    (Statement.agg, "Banana"),
    (Statement.derived_from, "BananaTree"),
    ("inAFruitBasketWith", "GrapeBunch"),
}

Types can reference each other by name (in fact, that's almost required for this whole model to make any sense), so there needs to be a class that can know about multiple types at once. This class is called TypeSystem:

class data_api.semantics.TypeSystem(namespace='')[source]¶

Multiple types, that may refer to each other by name.

__init__(self, spec)[source]¶

Initialize an empty container.

Parameters:namespace -- optional default namespace to prepend to the referenced names, unless they are already qualified

You can add all your types to the TypeSystem class with the add method:

TypeSystem.add(self, type_)[source]¶

Add a type.

Parameters:type (Type) -- New type to add
Returns:None

Then, once you have added all your types, you can get serialized schema that combine all the types in a way that's palatable to a given format. Right now, the only supported format is Avro:

TypeSystem.as_avro(self, name)[source]¶

Create and return avro schema.

Parameters:name -- Name of the schema to create, which should match the name of some type given to add().
Returns:The new avro schema.
Return type:dict
